Introduction 2019 5 year revalidation

The Risk Management Program at PR Farms Ranch 20 Cold Storage in Madera California complies with US EPA, OSHA and Cal ARP requirements. PR Farms, Inc. Madera Ranch 20 operates a seasonal cold storage and packing facility South of Madera California.  The facility is located just East of highway 99 in a rural farming area. Primary activities include pre-cooling, packing and cold storage of fruit, olives and vegetables. The most recent changes were the addition of a plate and frame glycol chiller to provide olive processing area cooling to a seperate and detached processing room. Existing capacity and ammonia inventory is fine.



The facility was originally constructed in the late 1970's with retrofits in 1991, 1998, 2001 and 2014. The facility is operated by trained on-site operators with major maintenance by a qualified ammonia refrigeration contractor. 



The procedures used for complying with the RM Program regulations are outlined by the following major steps:

1.    Identify Covered Processes

2.    Determine Program Level

3.    Establish a Management System

4.    Conduct a 5-year Accident History

5.    Perform Hazard Assessments

6.    Develop an Accident Prevention Program

7.    Develop an Emergency Response Program and

8.    Prepare a Risk Management Plan (RMP)



Publication or sharing of OCA portions of RMP materials can be in violation of the Chemical Safety Information, Site Security and Fuels Regulatory Relief Act (PL106-40). 



1.    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

We at PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage are committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  Our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training demonstrates this commitment.  It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.





2.    The Stationary Source and the Regula

ted Substances Handled:

Our facility's primary activities revolve around processing and storage of grapes.  This activity is consistent with SIC 0723/ NAICS 115114 post harvest crop activities. Anhydrous ammonia is the major regulated substance present at our facility.  The entire ammonia inventory is more than 10,000 lbs. and used as a refrigerant in a closed loop refrigeration system. Under planned operation and PM there should only be minor incidental or operational loss of refrigerant. Sulfur Dioxide is used for fumigation however inventories are below levels necessary for including.



3.    The Worst Case Release Scenario(s) and the Alternative Release Scenario(s), including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for each reported scenario:

The worst-case release scenario mandated by the RMP Rule is a standardized hypothetical situation intended to promote "dialogue". According to the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration "The worst-case situation represents an extremely improbable (and for many facilities impossible) set of circumstances rather than a credible accident scenario. Release quantities and hazard distances derived there from for the worst-case scenario should not be used as a basis for emergency response planning."



To evaluate the worst case and alternative release scenarios for ammonia we have used the methodology given in the Model Risk Management Program and Plan for Ammonia Refrigeration by SAIC.  This included worst case and alternate case releases. Details are not provided in the Executive Summary as required in recent rulemaking since this information is public and might be used by a terrorist.



4.    The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:

Our facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 CFR Part 68 of the EPA.  This facility was designed and constructed in accordanc

e with mechanical codes at the time of construction and retrofits. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in place at our stationary source.



Process Safety Information

PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage maintains a detailed record of written safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all the processes.



Process Hazard Analysis

Our facility conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our processes are identified and controlled efficiently.  The methodology used to carry out these analyses is What if /Checklist.  The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at a regular interval of 5 years.  Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.



Operating Procedures

For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered processes, PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage maintains written operating procedures.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround. They also include Confined Space, Oil Draining, LOTO/Line-Breaking, Ammonia loading and Emergency Pressure release operation. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved with the processes.



Training

PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage has a training documentation program in place to ensure that employees who are operating processes are completely competent in the operating procedures associated with these processes.  Our initial training consisted of several days of specific training on-site. Refresher training is provided at least every 3 years and more frequently as needed. The newest employee has attended the CUPA Chemical

Safety Day in Bakersfield.



Mechanical Integrity

PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage plans on more frequent maintenance checks and documentation on process equipment to ensure proper operations.  Most recently SRV's were replaced and compressor maintenance and rebuilds performed. Process equipment examined by regular checks includes pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps.  Maintenance procedures are carried out by qualified personnel or Refrigeration Contractors with a strong background in maintenance practices.  Specialized training is provided to these personnel as needed.  Any equipment deficiencies identified during maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.



Management of Change

Written procedures are in place at PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and procedures.  Process operators, maintenance personnel and all other employees whose job tasks are affected by a change in a process are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the changes. The most recent addition of a plate and frame glycol chiller went through a MOC process.



Pre-startup Reviews

Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in established processes will be a regular practice at PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage.  These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.



Compliance Audits

PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage will conduct audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP Rule are being implemented.  These audits will be carried out at least every 3 years, include someone knowledgeable in the RMP and NH3 process. Any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are tracked and undertaken in a s

afe and prompt manner. The most recent was done in conjunction with the Clovis facility.



Incident Investigation

PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage will promptly investigate any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of a regulated substance.  These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring.  All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years. Any incidents that release a reportable amount of Ammonia require updating the 5 year Accident History and filing a revised RMP with the EPA.



Employee Participation

PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage truly believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort.  Company employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, our employees have access to all information collected as part of the facility's compliance with the RMP Rule including information resulting from process hazard analyses.



 

Hot Work Permit

At PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage Hot Work Permit procedures are now in place and enforced. Preventing accidents related to welding and cutting while alerting others at the facility that this type of work is occurring are important prevention steps.





Contractors

On occasion, our company hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of the contractor is carried out.  PR Farms Madera has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related the contractor's work and the processes.  Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response to an accidental release of a regulated substance.





5.    Five-year Accident History

There were no reportable accidents for the accident hi

story. All significant releases or potential evacuations will be reported to the Madera County Environmental Health. Any reportable release requires updating the Accident History within 6 months.



6.    Emergency Response Plan

PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage has a written emergency action plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials.  PR Farms Madera Ranch 20 Cold Storage employees will not enter a hazardous area. The plan includes aspects of defensive emergency actions including evaluation, adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas. We will only take offensive actions that can be done remotely and provide support to County or private responders.



To ensure proper functioning, our personal protection equipment is regularly inspected and serviced.  In addition, the plan is regularly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response. Any changes in Emergency Contact information is reported within 30 days.



7.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Additional Labels on NH3 equipment, Replacing SRV's, Emergency Ventilation in the mechanical room and securing small lines and tubing.
